alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Lafayette; Saline (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Carroll, northwestern Saline and eastern Lafayette Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Corder, or near Higginsville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Higginsville, Lexington, Carrollton, Waverly, Norborne, Corder, Alma, Malta Bend, Blackburn, Wakenda, Dover, Aullville and Grand Pass. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 48 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central, north central and west central Missouri.
